clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare as primary lymph node tumor, usually an extension of soft tissue tumor* May represent a metastasis from epithelioid hemangioma of bone ([Int J Surg Pathol 2006;14:9](16501828)) or pulmonary sclerosing hemangioma ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2003;127:321](12653576), [Ann Thorac Surg 2005;80:2351](16305908))

Case reports

* 4 year old boy with inguinal node hemangioma ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1989;113:804](2662936))* 21 year old woman with hemangiomas of small bowel and local lymph nodes ([J Clin Pathol 2000;53:552](10961181))

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Resembles hemangiomas at other sites* Discrete mass lesion, either capillary or cavernous* May be highly cellular or epithelioid

Microscopic (histologic) images

AFIP images  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_032.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_032.jpg)

Hemangioma

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_031.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_031.jpg)

Capillary / cavernous hemangioma

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_035.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_035.jpg)

Epithelioid hemangioma

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_033.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_033.jpg)

Lobular capillary hemangioma

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_034.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip21_034.jpg)

Cellular hemangioma

Differential diagnosis

* [Kimura disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodeskimurasdisease.html): inflammatory process with prominent vessels* Other **vascular tumors*** [Vascular transformation of sinuses](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesvasculartransformationofsinuses.html): limited to sinuses
